titles.title: A concurrent resolution expressing the sense of the Senate regarding the accounting standards proposed by the Financial Accounting Standards Board.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S10933-10934)
Referred to the Committee on Banking.

committee.name: Senate Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

bill.summary: 8/6/1993--Introduced. Expresses the sense of the Congress that: (1) the accounting standards proposed by the Financial Accounting Standards Board will have grave economic consequences, particularly for businesses in new-growth sectors, which rely heavily on entrepreneurship; and (2) the Board should not change the current accounting rules by requiring that businesses deduct the value of stock options from profits.
